page.title: 04CLUB DAY CONTINUED.
page.content: During the 19th Century,there grew up many societies in the area and each year their members would gather together in a local pub for their annual meeting. There was much good_humoured rivalry between clubs.One year,accompanied by the town band,a Club decided to parade through the streets before getting down to business!The following year some other societies did the same thing carrying their banners through the streets and soon the clubs all agreed to hold their meetings on the same day. During Queen Victoria's reign the celebrations expanded to include a market and a fair every third Saturday in June.Towards the end of the last Century the schools were in the{Club {Day}procession.The first Lytham Club Day Rose Queen was crowned in 1894 and this custom has continued ever since.
